required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Myo-inositol in Women With Polycystic Ovary Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Myo-inositol on the Menstrual Cycle, Hyperandrogenism, Chronic Inflammatory Process and Carbohydrate Metabolism in Women With Polycystic Ovary Syndrome

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

clinical_study.source: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The study will be carried out at the hospital of the medical school of sao paulo (HC-FMUSP) and the goal is to compare the effects of the administration of myo-inositol in relation to the effects of metformin in women with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and insulin resistance or glucose intolerance. Menstrual cycle, hyperandrogenism, chronic inflammatory process, carbohydrate metabolism, hepatic steatosis will be evaluated. In total, 60 women in the reproductive period, with a variable age between 18 and 36 years old will be recruited and randomized in two groups: intervention- myo-inositol for 6 months, control group will use metformin also for 6 months.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will involve 60 women in the reproductive period, with a variable between 18 and 36 years old and diagnosed with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), according to Rotterdam- European Society of Human Reproduction and Embryology (ESHRE) / American Society for Reproductive Medicine (ASRM) criteria defined in 2003 and by the entity The Androgen Excess and Polycystic Ovary Syndrome Society (AE-PCOS) 2018, and insulin resistance (presence acanthosis nigricans) or glucose intolerance (fasting glycemia, glycated hemoglobin or 75g glycemic overload and blood glucose assessment after 2 hours). It is a comparative and non-inferiority study of myo-inositol in relation to metformin. They will be divided into two groups of 30 patients: Group I (control) - they will receive metformin, orally, three times a day; Group II (experiment) - they will receive myo-inositol 2g, orally, twice a day.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Comparative and non-inferiority study of myo-inositol in relation to metformin. They will be divided into two groups of 30 patients: Group I (control) - they will receive metformin, orally, three times a day; Group II (experiment) - they will receive myo-inositol 2g, orally, twice a day.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 months for up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Glucose tolerance curve with insulin curve will be performed every 3 months.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 months for up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Glycated hemoglobin will be performed every 3 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in ultrasound of the ovaries
primary_outcome.description: Transvaginal ultrasound to assess ovarian volume (measured in cubic centimeters) will be done before and after treatment.
Ultrasound of the ovaries will be done before and after treatment for antral follicle count (all follicles from 2 to 9 mm will be measured)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 months for up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Body mass index (kg/m2) will be assessed every 3 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Abdominal Circumference and Hip Circumference
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 months for up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Abdominal circumference and hip circumference (measured in centimeters) will be assessed every 3 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in body weight in kilograms
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 months for up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Patients will be weighed every 3 months (measured in kilograms).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 months for up to 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Medication use diary will be delivered and will be reviewed every 3 months to assess adherence to treatment (good adherence will be considered use of more than 80% of the medication provided).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 months for up to 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire will be carried out every 3 months for patient to describe the 3 main side effects and how much they have hindered the treatment or not.

Initial liver ultrasound will be done and repeated after 6 months of treatment to assess the presence or absence of hepatic steatosis and classify it as mild (grade 1), moderate (grade 2) and severe (grade 3).
Liver enzymes (aspartate aminotransferase, alanine aminotransferase,alkaline phosphatase) will be collected before and after treatment
Chronic inflammatory markers will be accessed by analyzing RNA messenger from cervical-vaginal cytology before and after treatment.
Chronic inflammatory process will be also evaluated by serum measurement of c-reactive protein before and after treatment.
Serum homocysteine dosage will be done before and after treatment to help assess a chronic inflammatory process.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 months for up to 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Serum dosage of the lipid profile (high density lipoprotein - HDL, low density lipoprotein - LDL , very low density lipoprotein - VLDL, triglycerides, total cholesterol) will be done every 3 months
Modified Ferriman-Gallwey Score will be performed before and after treatment and patients with a score above 7 will be considered hirsute.
Hormonal dosage (FSH - Follicle-stimulating hormone, LH - luteinizing hormone, progesterone, estradiol) will be preformed before and after treatment.

arm_group.description: 30 women with resistance insulin or glucose intolerance will receive myo-inositol 2g, orally, twice a day for 6 months.
30 women with resistance insulin or glucose intolerance will receive metformin, orally, three times a day for 6 months

intervention.description: 30 women with polycystic ovary syndrome and insulin resistance or glucose intolerance will used myo-inositol 2g twice daily for 6 months, having a re-evaluation every 3 months. Evaluation will be made by transvaginal ultrasound, abdominal ultrasound, inflammatory tests, hormonal tests, glycemic curve with insulin curve, lipid profile, body mass index, evaluation of abdominal and hip circumference.

30 women with polycystic ovary syndrome and insulin resistance or glucose intolerance will used metformin three times a day for 6 months, having a re-evaluation every 3 months. Evaluation will be made by transvaginal ultrasound, abdominal ultrasound, inflammatory tests, hormonal tests, glycemic curve with insulin curve, lipid profile, body mass index, evaluation of abdominal and hip circumference.

facility.name: Hospital das Clinicas da Faculdade de Medicina da Universidade de Sao Paulo
